facts: Ancient Sumerians in Mesopotamia invented one of the earliest writing systems, called cuneiform, by pressing wedge-shaped marks into clay tablets.
The ancient Egyptians built pyramids as royal tombs, and the Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest human-made structure for thousands of years.
The Indus Valley Civilization built planned cities like Mohenjo-daro with straight streets and advanced drainage systems for managing water and waste.
Ancient Chinaâ€™s Shang Dynasty used oracle bones for divination, and the inscriptions on them are some of the oldest examples of Chinese writing.
The ancient Greeks developed early forms of democracy in Athens, where some citizens could vote directly on important decisions.
The Roman Empire spread roads, laws, and engineering across Europe and beyond, and Roman roads were designed to last with layered stone construction.
The Maya civilization in Mesoamerica created a complex calendar system and a written script, and they made careful observations of the Sun, Moon, and planets.
